intro: Mesembryanthus, commonly known as the ice plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy flowers that often bloom in response to rainfall. Many species have a fleshy, crinkled appearance, which helps them store water in arid environments. They typically produce small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, red, and pink. Mesembryanthus species are popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to their low water requirements and ornamental value.
